method.name: Variable Similarity Metric

reference.ref: D. G. Lowe, Similarity metric learning for a variable-kernel classifier, Neural Computation 7:1 (1995) 72-85.

generalDescription.type: Preprocess Method. Data Reduction. Instance Selection. Decremental
generalDescription.objective: Reduce the size of the training set without losing precision or accuracy in order to a posterior classification
generalDescription.howWork: In order to reduce storage and remove noisy instances, an instance t is removed if all k of its neighbors are of the same class, even if they are of a different class than t. The instance is only removed if its neighbors are at least 60% sure of their classification. The VSM method typically uses a fairly large k (i.e., k = 10).

parameterSpec.param: Number of neighbors: Integer value. Number of nearest instances considered to classify an example using the K-Nearest Neighbor Rule

Distance Function: K-NN implements two distance functions. a) Euclidean with normalized attributed and b) HVDM (see paper D.R. Wilson, T.R. Martinez. Reduction Tecniques For Instance-Based Learning Algorithms. Machine Learning 38:3 (2000) 257-286.)
